text:
When saving password to a file by the cvspass task in windows, there will be an 
carriage return after the password. If this password is then used by the cvs 
task, the carriage return will be sent as part of the password. The result is 
that the user is not authorized.
creator: opensource@saynomoo.com

text:
I'm using Cygwin's cvs and my .cvspass file contains 0D0A at the end of
everyline and works without issue, could you please give more information wrt
programs and versions?

The code in question is src/main/org/apache/tools/ant/taskdefs/CVSPass.java
either line 145 (buf.append(line).append(StringUtils.LINE_SEP)) where
StringUtils.LINE_SEP = System.getProperty("line.separator") or line 157
writer.println(pwdfile) (where "The println() methods use the platform's own
notion of line separator rather than the newline character.").

text:
I'm also using cygwin cvs (v. 1.11.0-1).
OS: Windows 2000 sp2
Apache Ant version 1.5 compiled on July 9 2002
Java 1.4.0_01

The CVSPass saves the line with 0D0A. 

All other lines in the auth request that is sent to the server end with 0A (, 
which I believe is the correct line ending when the client and server 
communicates), but the line that contains passwd ends with 0D0A. If the 0D is 
removed from the file, password is sent correctly and authorization is 
succesfull. 

I don't know what is the correct syntax of the cvspass file, but if the cvs 
login command is run directly in cygwin, there will be only 0A in the end of 
the line. Maybe the login command should just be delegated to the cvs 
executable?

I just checked and my cvs executable creates a passfile with 0D0A and works 
just fine.

>cvs -v
Concurrent Versions System (CVS) 1.11 (client)

I think I have replaced the cvs shipped in cygwin by the one found downloaded 
from the website. I had some stranges lock issues with it while it does not 
happen with this version.

I upgraded to the latest version to check and it produces 0D0A as well
>cvs -v
Concurrent Versions System (CVS) 1.11.2 (client)

Tell me what results you have with the latest non cygwin version
http://www.cvshome.org/dev/codewindow.html
